column4: I installed WINE but i can't find it anywhere on my system...whats' up with that?
wine isn't generaly used through GUI. type wine <filename.exe> to launch windows exe
yep
Thanks a lot!
not everything runs well under wine and sometimes you need to play with the config etc
Yea i was assuming it woudnl't be foolproof or anything. Just want to try running OneNote for school ;)
:/ OneNote won't work even under CrossoverOffice. I have tried. Wish it did
Noooo :'(
What further stinks is that there is realy no good replacement for Linux. I have been using google notepad but :/
yea i'm just using the word processor from openoffice but it's nothign like onenote
not at all like it. I LOVE oneNote
i wonder if anybody'll work on a replacement for onenote? :)
I hope so.
it basicly lets you build html content a little faster. Nothing like OneNote but it is a great package
look at BasKet, might be worth a try...
you get that? look at BasKet as a onenote replacement :)
I hadn't seem that one. Looks promising. I don't have time to check it out now but thanks for the link
yup :)
I have looked at all the packages that the basKet homepage mentions it imports from and they all fall short in one way or another :/ basKet actually looks good though
yea it looks as close as it gets for now
wow thanks. I just went ahead and installed and launched it and at first glance it looks awsome. Even if it doesn't turn out to be oneNote, is damn sure beets google notepad :)
yea i just launched it too.... quick note: pushing the - key before typing makes a Bullet...(i found that very important hha)
and if you want to make bullets on new lines just push Ctrl or Shft plus Enter
great find. I have to run but I certainly appriciate it.
